section.title: Project
section.p: The Simetron Project is an open source project, sponsored by The Olympum Group, that aims at creating a modular traffic simulator for metropolitan networks.
Simetron is designed as an open plugin architecture, written in C#, with multi-platform support via the Mono runtime.
Simetron consists of the following modules:

ul.li: Workbench - A graphical user interface for monitoring and controlling simulations, analyzing results, and editing networks. [Started]
Microkernel - The small footprint simulation engine based on a distributed workflow engine. [Started]

section.p: The Simetron Project is hosted by berliOS, a free service to Open Source developers offering easy access to the best in CVS, mailing lists, bug tracking, message boards/forums, task management, site hosting, permanent file archival, full backups, and total web-based administration.

section.title: Getting Involved
section.p: Anyone can participate. All interested developers are welcome to join and participate. Bug reports and patches are highly welcome.
